argumentText:
ARGUMENT
x y

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_ordtr | |- ( Ord A -> Tr A ) |
| 2 | 1 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> Tr A ) |
| 3 |  | #P_dford2 | |- ( Ord A <-> ( Tr A /\ A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) ) |
| 4 | 3 | #P_simprbi | |- ( Ord A -> A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) |
| 5 | 4 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) |
| 6 |  | #P_3orcomb | |- ( ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) <-> ( x e. y \/ y e. x \/ x = y ) ) |
| 7 | 6 | #P_2ralbii | |- ( A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) <-> A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ y e. x \/ x = y ) ) |
| 8 | 5, 7 | #P_sylib | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ y e. x \/ x = y ) ) |
| 9 |  | #P_simpr | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> B e. A ) |
| 10 |  | #P_tratrb | |- ( ( Tr A /\ A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ y e. x \/ x = y ) /\ B e. A ) -> Tr B ) |
| 11 | 2, 8, 9, 10 | #P_syl3anc | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> Tr B ) |
| 12 |  | #P_trss | |- ( Tr A -> ( B e. A -> B C_ A ) ) |
| 13 | 2, 9, 12 | #P_sylc | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> B C_ A ) |
| 14 |  | #P_ssralv2 | |- ( ( B C_ A /\ B C_ A ) -> ( A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) -> A. x e. B A. y e. B ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) ) |
| 15 | 14 | #P_ex | |- ( B C_ A -> ( B C_ A -> ( A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) -> A. x e. B A. y e. B ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) ) ) |
| 16 | 13, 13, 5, 15 | #P_syl3c | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> A. x e. B A. y e. B ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) |
| 17 |  | #P_dford2 | |- ( Ord B <-> ( Tr B /\ A. x e. B A. y e. B ( x e. y \/ x = y \/ y e. x ) ) ) |
| 18 | 11, 16, 17 | #P_sylanbrc | |- ( ( Ord A /\ B e. A ) -> Ord B ) |
\
 An element of an ordinal class is ordinal.  Proposition 7.6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 36.  This is an alternate proof of ~ ordelord using the Axiom of Regularity indirectly through ~ dford2 . dford2 is a weaker definition of ordinal number.  Given the Axiom of Regularity, it need not be assumed that ` _E Fr A ` because this is inferred by the Axiom of Regularity. ~ ordelordALT is ~ ordelordALTVD without virtual deductions and was automatically derived from ~ ordelordALTVD using the tools program translate..without..overwriting.cmd and Metamath's minimize command.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 18-Feb-2012.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
